Yes, there are several things you can do to help protect the oceans beyond changing your eating habits. Some additional ideas include:

1. Reduce plastic use: Single-use plastics such as bags, straws, and utensils contribute to marine pollution. You can reduce plastic waste by carrying reusable bags, bottles, and utensils. 2. Support ocean-friendly businesses: Support businesses that operate sustainably by choosing products from companies that demonstrate environmentally friendly practices. 3. Participate in beach cleanups: Participate in local beach cleanups to prevent plastics and other waste from entering the ocean. 4. Advocate for ocean protection: Contact your government representatives to voice your support for policies that protect the oceans and marine life. 5. Educate others: You can spread awareness about the importance of oceans and marine conservation by sharing information with your friends and social media networks, and encouraging others to take action. By taking these actions, you can contribute towards protecting the oceans and preserving marine life. Remember, every little effort counts.
